skill.name: design-md
skill.description: Analyze Stitch projects and synthesize a semantic design system into DESIGN.md files
skill.summary: Transforms technical design assets into natural language design documentation for consistent UI generation
skill.author: google-labs-code

security_audit.summary: All static findings are false positives. The scanner incorrectly flagged hex color codes as weak cryptographic algorithms, markdown backticks as shell execution, and Stitch MCP tool names as C2 keywords. This is documentation-only content that generates design system files using authorized API calls.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Hex Color Codes Flagged as Cryptographic Patterns
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged hex color codes (e.g., #294056, #FCFAFA) as weak cryptographic algorithms. These are legitimate design tokens in documentation.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Hex color codes are standard design tokens. Pattern appears in documentation only, not executable code.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Markdown Backticks Flagged as Shell Execution
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged markdown code block syntax (backticks) as Ruby/shell backtick execution. Markdown backticks are formatting syntax, not code execution.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks in markdown create code blocks for documentation display. No shell or Ruby execution occurs.

high_findings.title: False Positive: Stitch MCP Tool Names Flagged as C2 Keywords
high_findings.description: Scanner flagged legitimate Stitch MCP tool names (list_projects, get_screen, list_screens) as C2 command-and-control keywords.
high_findings.confidence_reasoning: These are documented API method names for the Stitch MCP Server. No malicious command-and-control behavior exists.

medium_findings.title: False Positive: Standard Documentation URLs Flagged
medium_findings.description: Scanner flagged the official Stitch documentation URL as a hardcoded network endpoint.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: URL points to official Stitch documentation (stitch.withgoogle.com). This is legitimate documentation reference.

content.value_statement: Design systems are often trapped in technical CSS values that are hard to translate into prompts. This skill analyzes visual assets and translates them into natural language design documentation that ensures consistent UI generation.
actual_capabilities: Extracts color palettes from screen assets and assigns semantic names
Translates CSS/Tailwind values into descriptive design language
Documents typography hierarchy with natural language descriptions
Generates DESIGN.md files following semantic design system format
Maps component patterns to design tokens with functional descriptions
limitations: Requires access to Stitch MCP Server for project and screen data
Cannot create new design systems from scratch without existing reference screens
Output quality depends on completeness of source screen metadata

use_cases.title: Create consistent design language for a new Stitch project
use_cases.description: Generate a comprehensive DESIGN.md that serves as the source of truth for prompting Stitch to create new screens that match your existing design language.
use_cases.target_user: Designers working with Stitch to build UI components

use_cases.title: Document existing design patterns for team collaboration
use_cases.description: Analyze completed screens and produce human-readable design documentation that helps team members understand and extend the design system.
use_cases.target_user: Design system engineers and frontend developers

use_cases.title: Create reference documentation for AI-assisted design iteration
use_cases.description: Build a semantic design guide that enables precise prompts for incremental improvements to existing screens while maintaining design consistency.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Design Documentation
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze the [Project Name] project and generate a DESIGN.md file documenting the design system from the Home screen.
prompt_templates.scenario: Quick start for documenting a project's visual design

prompt_templates.title: Specific Screen Analysis
prompt_templates.prompt: Retrieve the [Screen Name] screen from the [Project Name] project. Analyze the visual design and create a comprehensive DESIGN.md that covers color palette, typography, component styles, and layout principles.
prompt_templates.scenario: Documenting a specific screen's design language

prompt_templates.title: Design Token Extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Extract all design tokens from the [Project Name] project including colors, spacing values, border-radius patterns, and shadow styles. Generate semantic descriptions for each token with functional roles.
prompt_templates.scenario: Creating a complete token inventory for a design system

prompt_templates.title: Multi-Screen Design Synthesis
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze multiple screens from the [Project Name] project to identify consistent design patterns. Synthesize a unified DESIGN.md that captures the core design language while documenting component-specific variations.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building comprehensive design documentation from multiple screens

best_practices: Use semantic color names that convey character and purpose (e.g., 'Deep Muted Teal-Navy' rather than just 'Dark Blue')
Always include both descriptive names and hex codes for colors to enable precise AI prompting
Document functional roles for each design element to guide consistent usage across screens
anti_patterns: Using technical CSS class names without translation (e.g., 'rounded-xl' instead of 'generously rounded corners')
Omitting color codes and relying only on descriptive names
Failing to explain the functional purpose of design elements

faq.question: What is DESIGN.md and why do I need it?
faq.answer: DESIGN.md serves as the source of truth for prompting Stitch to generate new screens. It translates technical design values into natural language that Stitch interprets for consistent UI creation.

faq.question: What access do I need to use this skill?
faq.answer: You need access to the Stitch MCP Server and a Stitch project with at least one designed screen to analyze.

faq.question: What formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: This skill works with HTML, CSS, and Tailwind-based designs. It extracts Tailwind classes and custom CSS to create design tokens.

faq.question: How long does documentation take?
faq.answer: The skill typically completes analysis and documentation in under 2 minutes depending on screen complexity.

faq.question: Can I update DESIGN.md as my project evolves?
faq.answer: Yes. Re-run the skill on updated screens to generate revised documentation that reflects design changes.

faq.question: What makes good semantic design documentation?
faq.answer: Good documentation uses evocative, human-readable descriptions for all design elements and always includes functional context for each component.
